page.title: 11LIGHT INDUSTRY
page.content:
Following a fire several years ago at a large garage in the village, then used to produce glass-fibre cabs for milk floats, the site became available for redevelopment. A design for a number of small light industrial units was approved by the Local Authority and this has, most successfully, been recently completed by a building firm in the village.
This has produced much needed local employment with some people commuting into the village each day, while the majority of inhabitants still travel outwards, many as far as London by British Rail to Waterloo Station.
